title: Walks around Ridge Hertfordshire Walking Route

images.caption: Bridge over Catherine Bourne and waymarker, near Rabley Park, Ridge, Hertfordshire. Catherine Bourne flows eastwards into Mimmshall Brook, which then flows to the River Colne.

images.title: Peter O'Connor aka anemoneprojectors, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Monument at Rabley Park. The plaque on this momument reads: "This monument is thought to have been erected by the Dudding family who lived here 1797-1812 to celebrate their cousin Admiral Nelson's victory at Trafalgar. Re-erected 1999. That the Earl of Warwick died here after the Battle of Barnet in 1471 is probably a myth." Rabley Park, Ridge, Hertfordshire.

images.title: Rape Seed in Flower With Wood in the Distance by Bikeboy, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Country scene

description: This circular walk from Hertfordshire based Ride explores the countryside to the west, visiting the Catherine Bourne River, Littleridge Wood and the neighbouring village of South Mimms. You'll also pass Shenley where you could pick up our walk and visit the fascinating de Havilland Aircraft Museum. The northern part of this route uses a section of the Hertfordshire Way. The long distance trail can be followed east through Potters Bar to visit Northaw Great Wood where there's miles of peaceful trails to try. Heading west would take you towards Borehamwood, the pretty lakes at Aldenham Country Park and Watford .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Old Guinea has a splendid large garden seating 150 people. You can enjoy a meal here with a fabulous view of the surrounding countryside. You can find them at Crossoaks Lane, EN6 3LH.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The country trails make for a fine dog walk and the Old Guinea mentioned above is also dog friendly.

display_address: Deeves Hall Lane, South Mimms and Ridge, Ridge, Hertsmere, Hertfordshire, England, EN6 3LP, United Kingdom
